title: Cougars topple Thrashers
text:
Jared Janke scored one goal and set up two others on Sunday in Souris as the Southwest Cougars handed the Winnipeg Thrashers their first loss of the Manitoba AAA Midget Hockey League season, 6-3. 
Elsewhere on Sunday, it was: Brandon Wheat Kings 7, Norman Northstars 2. 
On Saturday, it was: Wheat Kings 5, Northstars 0; and Thistles 3, Yellowhead Chiefs 1. 
In Souris, John Patmore added a goal and an assist for the Cougars (2-1-0-1), who scored three times in the final frame. Rylan Rommelaere made 16 saves on 17 shots in the first 22:51 before being replaced by Brady Gordon, who made 22 saves on 24 shots the rest of the way. 
Kyle Whitshire had a goal and an assist for Winnipeg (3-1-0-0). 
Brandon 7 Norman 2 
In Thompson, Jackson Popple and Bryce Webber both scored twice as the Wheat Kings (2-2-0-0), who had only 13 skaters, completed their weekend sweep. 
Max Paddock made 26 saves in the Brandon net for the win. Tramiane Trout opened the scoring for the Northstars (0-4-0-1). 
Brandon 5 Norman 0 
On Saturday, Chipper Osiname had a pair of goals for the Wheat Kings, while Caley Barscello, Jaymes Knee and Popple added singles. 
Josh Petersen made 23 saves for the shutout in a game that featured 235 minutes in penalties. 
Winnipeg 3 Yellowhead 1 
In Shoal Lake, Mackenzie Belinksi tied the game in the third period for the Chiefs (1-2-0-2), but Eric Lavoie scored the winning goal just over two minutes later for the Thrashers. Riley Lamb made 44 saves in the loss. 
Â» The Brandon Sun
